name: Ilona's Common Bond Online Quiz | Common Bond 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the fourth book of the New Testament called in the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
John.

	John is considered one of the four books known as the Gospels. John is different from the other three in the fact that it does not begin with Jesus' lineage.

questions.text: What is Peewee Herman's real first name?
questions.explanation:
Paul.

	Paul Reubens aka Peewee Herman was born August 27, 1952 in Peekskill, NY. He is best known for his TV show "Peewee's Playhouse", as well as his movie "Big Top Peewee".

questions.text: What was the name of Patty Lane's boyfriend on "The Patty Duke Show"?
questions.explanation:
Richard.

	Richard Harrison was played by Eddie Applegate. Richard was always hungry on the show.

questions.text: Mohs Scale test how _____________ a mineral is?
questions.explanation:
Hard.

	The softest mineral at 1 is talc while the hardest mineral at 10 is diamond. The diamond can cut through glass because it is so hard. However talc cannot cut through anything and is easy to break because it is so soft.

questions.text: What is the name of the father in the cartoon "The Jetsons"?
questions.explanation:
George.

	George Jetson worked for Spacely Sprockets. That is, he worked there when he wasn't getting fired. "The Jetsons" was a Hanna-Barbera cartoon.

questions.text: In the comic strip "Peanuts" who is often referred to as being a fussbudget?
questions.explanation:
Lucy.

	Lucy often made life difficult for Charlie Brown. She would do things such as asking him to kick a football and then pulling it away. Likewise, she often made life difficult for her little brother Linus because she hated that he carried around his blanket all the time.

questions.text: Who recorded the song "Never Say Goodbye" in 1982?
questions.explanation:
Yoko Ono.

	Yoko Ono was born February 18, 1933. She was born in Tokyo, Japan. Yoko Ono not only had a musical career she also was an accomplished artist.

questions.text: Complete this lyric from the song by the Beach Boys, "__________ me, Rhonda."
questions.explanation:
Help.

	"Help Me, Rhonda" was written by Brian Wilson and Mike Love in 1965. The Beach Boys have been a group since 1961. However, not all the members have been the same this entire time as people have died and been fired since it's formation.

questions.text: What does the Spanish word "ayer" mean?
questions.explanation:
yesterday.

	Today in Spanish is hoy. Later in Spanish is tarde and now is ahora.

questions.text: What music group do these nine words have in common?
questions.explanation:
The Beatles & Beatles.

	John Lennon was born on Oct. 9, 1940. He was murdered on December 8, 1980. Paul McCartney was born on June 18, 1942. Richard Starkey is better known as drummer Ringo Starr. He was born on July 7, 1940. George Harrison was born on February 25, 1943 and died on November 29, 2001 from lung cancer. In 1964 the Beatles had a song called "Hard Days Night".  "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds" was one of the hits from the Beatles. According to John Lennon it was inspired by a picture his son drew.  Yoko Ono was married to John Lennon. It was rumored for a long time that she was the cause of The Beatles breaking up.  "Help" was both a hit song and a Beatles movie. "Yesterday" was written by Paul McCartney.
